org.mxupdate.update.program
Class JPOProgram_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.update.AbstractObject_mxJPO
      org.mxupdate.update.program.AbstractProgram_mxJPO
          org.mxupdate.update.program.JPOProgram_mxJPO
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class JPOProgram_mxJPO
extends AbstractProgram_mxJPO

The class is used to export, create, delete and update JPOs within MX.

Version:
$Id: JPOProgram_mxJPO.java 515 2009-08-16 14:08:51Z tim.moxter $
Author:
Tim Moxter
See Also:

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID

See Also:
Constant Field Values

JPO_REPLACE_TEST

private static final String JPO_REPLACE_TEST
The variable is used to evaluate if MX doubles backslashes (done from old MX versions). The name of the variable and the variable definition must not be changed or formatted in another way. Otherwise the test for doubled backslashes fails....

See Also:
write(ParameterCache_mxJPO, Appendable), Constant Field Values

NAME_SUFFIX

private static final String NAME_SUFFIX
String with name suffix (used also from the extract routine from Matrix).

See Also:
AbstractObject_mxJPO.export(ParameterCache_mxJPO, File), Constant Field Values

PARAM_BACKSLASHDOUBLED

private static final String PARAM_BACKSLASHDOUBLED
Defines the parameter to cache the information if the backslashes within MX are doubled (old MX versions) or not (new MX versions).

See Also:
write(ParameterCache_mxJPO, Appendable), Constant Field Values

PARAM_MARKSTART

private static final String PARAM_MARKSTART

private static final String PARAM_NEEDED

PATTERN_PACKAGE

private static final Pattern PATTERN_PACKAGE
Regular expression for the package line. The package name must be extracted to get the real name of the JPO used within MX.

See Also:
extractMxName(ParameterCache_mxJPO, File)

Method Detail

getMxNames

public Set<String> getMxNames(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache)
                       throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Searches for all programs which are JPOs and returns this list.

Specified by:
getMxNames in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
Returns:
set of all JPO program names
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the "list program" failed which is used to evaluate the JPO names

getFileName

public String getFileName()
Returns the file name for this JPO. The original method is overwritten because the name of a JPO could include points ('.') in a name which defines a package of a JPO (and is not included in the file name itself).

Overrides:
getFileName in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Returns:
file name of this administration (business) object (without package names)
See Also:
AbstractObject_mxJPO.export(ParameterCache_mxJPO, File)

getPath

public String getPath()
Returns the path where the file is located of this JPO including the sub path of the JPO package. A JPO has a package if the JPO name includes points ('.').

Overrides:
getPath in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Returns:
sub path including package path
See Also:
AbstractObject_mxJPO.getTypeDef()

extractMxName

public String extractMxName(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                            File _file)
                     throws UpdateException_mxJPO
If a file is a JPO (checked by calling the extraxtMxName method from super class), the package is extracted from file and returned together with the extracted MxName from the file.

Overrides:
extractMxName in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_file - file for which the MX name is searched
Returns:
MX name or null if the file is not an update file for current type definition
Throws:
UpdateException_mxJPO - if the JPO name could not be extracted from the file name
See Also:
PATTERN_PACKAGE
To do:
idea: maybe performance improvement by opening file itself and read only till class, interface or enum is defined....

write

protected void write(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                     Appendable _out)
              throws IOException,
                     matrix.util.MatrixException
Writes given JPO to given path for given name. The JPO code is first converted, because Matrix uses keywords which must be replaced to have real Java code. The conversion works like the original extract method, but only converts the given JPOs and not depending JPOs.

Specified by:
write in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_out - writer instance to the file where the JPO code must be written
Throws:
IOException - if the source code could not be written
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the source code of the JPO could not be extracted from MX

create

public void create(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache)
            throws Exception
Creates given JPO object from given type with given name.

Specified by:
create in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
Throws:
Exception - if create of JPO failed

update

public void update(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                   File _file,
                   String _newVersion)
            throws Exception
The JPO is updated by following steps if the modified date of the file is not the same as the the version property. Following steps are done:
  • reset the execute user
  • remove all properties
  • append TCL code of JPO
  • define new version
  • insert JPO code

Specified by:
update in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_file - reference to the file to update
_newVersion - new version which must be set within the update (or null if the version must not be set).
Throws:
Exception - if update of the JPO failed

compile

public boolean compile(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache)
                throws Exception
Compile current JPO.

Overrides:
compile in class AbstractObject_mxJPO
Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
Returns:
always true
Throws:
Exception - if the compile of the JPO failed
